meanings.definition: A cemetery, especially a large and elaborate one belonging to an ancient city.
meanings.sent1: The ancient necropolis was filled with tombs and monuments.
meanings.sent2: Visitors from around the world come to see the historic necropolis.
meanings.sent3: The necropolis was so vast that even ghosts got lost in it!
meanings.sent4: The necropolis stood like a silent city of the past, whispering stories of long-gone civilizations.
meanings.sent5: Walking through the necropolis felt like stepping back in time among the ancient graves.

meanings.definition: A city of the dead; a large burial ground.
meanings.sent1: The necropolis stretched far and wide, housing the remains of countless souls.
meanings.sent2: The necropolis was a somber place, with rows of gravestones marking the city of the dead.
meanings.sent3: Even in the necropolis, the ghosts complained about the noisy neighbors!
meanings.sent4: The necropolis loomed on the horizon like a shadowy metropolis of the deceased.
meanings.sent5: The moonlight cast an eerie glow over the necropolis, giving it an otherworldly aura.
